items.title: Apple’s more immersive CarPlay is dividing the auto industry
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- *Apple's CarPlay Ultra* takes over more car screens and integrates vehicle features, splitting automakers into adopters and blockers.
- Many automakers are hesitant to cede screen control despite strong *customer demand* for CarPlay.
- Industry-wide concerns focus on *data sharing standards* and protecting their own evolving digital ecosystems.

items.title: Dbrand Admits Poor Response to Switch 2 Joy-Con Grip Issues
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Dbrand acknowledged a *“spectacularly terrible response”* to complaints that its Killswitch Joy-Con Grips caused detachment of Switch 2 controllers under specific holding conditions. - The company will send *replacement grips* in July and is working on *two improved grip versions* to fix the issue. - Dbrand apologized and committed to better communication, recognizing users should be able to hold the console without detachment.

items.title: Hundreds of data brokers might be breaking state laws, say privacy advocates
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - *EFF and Privacy Rights Clearinghouse* found many data brokers failed to register across four states with data broker laws, possibly breaking the law. - States California, Texas, Oregon, and Vermont require registration for transparency and consumer control but many brokers appear inconsistently across registries. - Calls for investigations to enforce compliance and improve protections as state laws remain the primary defense amid stalled federal regulation.

items.title: The Trump Phone no longer promises it’s made in America
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: - The Trump Mobile T1 Phone officially removed claims of being "Made in the USA" from its website, replacing them with vague pro-American statements like "American-Proud Design." - The phone's specifications have changed, with screen size reduced and RAM info dropped, suggesting a possible supplier switch. - The phone's launch timeline shifted from September to an unspecified "later this year," raising doubts about its release.

items.title: Best Nintendo Switch 2 Cases Tested
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Tested 12 cases for the Nintendo Switch 2 with focus on *fit, protection,* and *accessibility* of features.
- The *Dbrand Killswitch* is the top pick for both handheld and docked play, offering secure fit and versatility despite being pricier and bulky dock adapter.
- Runner-up is *Genki's Attack Vector* with modular grips, while *Power A’s slim zip-up case* is the best budget-friendly protective option.

items.title: Anker’s versatile travel charger is on sale just in time for summer
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: - The **Anker Nano Travel Adapter** supports over 200 countries and can charge up to five devices, ideal for international summer travel at a discounted price of **$21.99**. - Its compact, foldable design includes multiple plug types and safety features but does not convert voltage. - Additional featured deals include the **Fitbit Ace LTE** kids smartwatch, **Alexa Voice Remote Pro**, and **Govee RGBIC TV Light Bars**.

items.title: The photographer using AI to reconstruct stories lost to censorship
items.author: Elise Morton
items.summary: - Almagul Menlibayeva uses **AI to revive erased Kazakh histories and cultural narratives** suppressed by Soviet and state censorship. - Her works blend *handwoven textiles* and AI-generated video to expose censored events like the 2022 Bloody January protests. - She views AI as a tool to *challenge historical erasure* and amplify marginalized voices, embedding personal myths into algorithmic outputs.

items.title: Apple’s Sports App Now Shows Tennis Scores
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - **Apple Sports app** has added live tennis scores, starting with Wimbledon, covering both men's and women's singles at Grand Slam and 1000-level tournaments. - The app introduces a **new home experience** that groups events by league and lets users prioritize their favorite teams. - Apple continues to enhance its sports offerings since the app's launch in February 2024, reflecting its growing interest in sports streaming.

items.title: How to safely maintain, use, and dispose of your power banks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Use power banks from **reputable brands** and prefer larger capacity ones (e.g., 20,000mAh) to **prolong battery life** and ensure safety.
- Avoid exposure to **extreme temperatures** and stop using power banks if damaged, swollen, or excessively hot.
- Properly **dispose or recycle** used or recalled power banks through authorized centers to prevent fires and environmental harm.

items.title: Sam Altman takes his ‘io’ trademark battle public
iPhone users on Google Fi will now get all their voicemails in the Phone app
Remedy is in control
Tesla's Robotaxi Launch Marred by Early Mishaps
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: - Tesla's robotaxi service faced issues like **phantom braking** and other mistakes during its early days.  - Problems are documented by users on social media since Texas lacks mandatory incident reporting for Tesla's autonomous vehicles. - Despite some praised smooth rides, increasing fleet size could lead to more incidents, raising safety concerns.

items.title: Insta360 launches Mic Air: tiny wireless mic like an AirTag
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: - *Insta360 Mic Air* is one of the smallest and lightest wireless microphones, comparable in size to an Apple AirTag and weighing just 7.9 grams. - It offers *up to 10 hours* of battery life with a range of 300 meters when used with its USB-C receiver and noise cancelling off. - The mic supports Bluetooth connectivity directly to select Insta360 cameras, though this reduces battery life and range, and requires a receiver dongle for smartphones.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Restock Exclusively for Walmart Plus Tonight
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - The *Nintendo Switch 2* will be restocked today at 9PM EDT exclusively for *Walmart Plus* subscribers, with both standalone and Mario Kart World bundle options available. - The console is priced at $449.99, with the bundle at $499.99, but no discounts apply. - *Walmart Plus* subscription costs $12.95/month or $98/year, with a 30-day free trial available for those seeking to purchase the Switch 2.

items.title: Discord is working on a Windows on Arm app
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: - *Discord* is developing a native **Windows on Arm** app, aiming for better performance than the current emulated experience. - An early preview shows significantly smoother use on Qualcomm-powered devices, eliminating lag issues. - This move joins other major apps like Chrome and Photoshop in supporting **Arm64** natively, enhancing Windows on Arm's ecosystem.

items.title: Russia Frees Four REvil Hackers After Sentencing
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: - Four members of the *REvil ransomware group* were sentenced to five years but released immediately, having spent sufficient time in custody. - Their crimes involved *fraud and carding*, primarily targeting US citizens, unrelated to REvil's major 2021 attacks. - The court seized luxury cars and over $1 million, but no fines were imposed, and no extradition to the US is expected.

items.title: Google launches Gemini CLI for developers' terminals
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduces **Gemini CLI**, an open-source AI agent that integrates Gemini’s coding, content generation, and research features directly into developers' terminals.
- It leverages Gemini 2.5 Pro with a **1 million token context window**, offering lightweight access and support for coding, content creation, problem-solving, and task management.
- Available for free preview with generous usage limits, Gemini CLI may compete strongly with other AI coding tools like GitHub Copilot and Anthropic’s Claude Code.

items.title: Ring camera alerts are about to get a lot smarter
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Ring introduces **Video Descriptions**, an AI feature giving detailed text alerts describing motion activity (e.g., “person with broom and mop is leaving”).
- Available to Ring Home Premium subscribers in the US and Canada, it enhances notifications to reduce unnecessary alerts and focus on relevant actions.
- The system aims to evolve with **custom anomaly alerts**, learning home routines to notify only unusual events, improving smart home usefulness but raising privacy and accuracy concerns.

items.title: HDMI 2.2 Supports 16K Video at 60Hz with 96Gbps Bandwidth
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- *HDMI 2.2 specification* is officially released, doubling bandwidth to *96Gbps* for new Ultra96 cables.
- Enables resolutions up to *16K at 60Hz*, plus 4K at 480Hz and 8K at 240Hz, improving future-proofing.
- Introduces the *Latency Indication Protocol* (LIP) for improved AV sync, simplifying cable type identification.

items.title: Veloretti Lite E-bikes: Lighter and Cheaper Models Released
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- *Veloretti* has launched the Ace Two Lite and Ivy Two Lite e-bikes, lighter and more affordable versions of their Electric Two series.  
- These Lite models shed 3 kg by switching to a simpler single-speed, belt-driven transmission, priced at €2,599.  
- They retain key features like a *540Wh removable battery*, hydraulic brakes, and integrated lighting, but remove the brake-light and automatic shifter.

items.title: Death Stranding 2 is bigger and more ambitious — and that includes its music
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - *Death Stranding 2* introduces a personal, in-game music player inspired by Hideo Kojima's real-life love of music, allowing players to create their own atmosphere while exploring vast environments. - Composer Woodkid collaborated for three years, creating dynamic music that reacts to gameplay, reflecting themes like intimacy, grief, and eco-anxiety. - The soundtrack features diverse styles, including haunting melodies and industrial sounds, enhancing the experience of long journeys much like a memorable road trip playlist.

items.title: The smaller Fairphone 6 introduces swappable accessories
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The *Fairphone 6* is smaller and lighter than its predecessor, featuring a larger, easily replaceable 4,415mAh battery and new modular accessories like a card holder and finger loop.
- It runs a Snapdragon 7s Gen 3, has a 6.31-inch 120Hz OLED display, and includes a *privacy-focused* Android version (/e/OS) in the US.
- Fairphone emphasizes *repairability* with 12 swappable parts and offers a *five-year warranty* plus *eight years of software support*; the phone features a new distraction-reducing software mode called Fairphone Moments.

items.title: Ironheart believes the children are the future
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: - *Ironheart* introduces Riri Williams, a talented young engineer who inherits Tony Stark's legacy with her own armored suit and AI. - The series balances high-flying action with grounded themes of grief, privilege, and identity, distinguishing itself from typical MCU fare. - Marvel's focus on new characters like Riri signals a shift away from the old guard, aiming to revitalize the MCU's future.

items.title: DJI ‘remains committed to the US market’ as shelves go bare of drones
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary: - DJI drones have disappeared from major US retailers like Best Buy and DJI's own US store, with shelves empty and stock low or backordered. - DJI blames US Customs and Border Protection for import issues linked to alleged Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act enforcement, though US officials haven't confirmed this. - DJI maintains commitment to the US market amid looming potential bans and escalating US-China trade tensions impacting availability and prices.

items.title: Nasal Spray Maker Challenges FTC's Policing of Health Claims
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary: - Xlear, a nasal spray company, is suing the FTC to make it harder for the agency to challenge health claims, arguing the FTC sets unreasonably high evidence standards. - The lawsuit comes amid shifts in government health policy and questions about agency powers after the Supreme Court struck down Chevron deference. - Xlear wants to market products as fluoride alternatives, emphasizing innovation but promising not to allow bogus claims.

items.title: MindsEye Developer Build a Rocket Boy Faces Layoffs After Troubled Launch
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - Build a Rocket Boy announced layoffs less than a month after the poorly reviewed and glitch-ridden launch of their game *MindsEye*. - The game, led by former Rockstar producer Leslie Benzies, had high ambitions but struggled with performance and canceled sponsored streams. - About 100 of the 500 employees might be impacted as the studio tries to fulfill promises despite challenging market competition.

items.title: The US is stripping its forests of decades-old protections
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The USDA is rescinding the 2001 Roadless Rule, removing protections from nearly 59 million acres of national forest to boost timber production and land development.  
- Conservationists warn this will lead to *industrial-scale logging* and increase wildfire risks, as roads and logging can worsen fire conditions.  
- Experts argue the move ignores *modern wildfire management* strategies and threatens forests vital for *carbon sequestration* and ecosystem health.

items.title: The Titan 2 is a modernized BlackBerry with 5G, Android, and a second screen
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Titan 2 smartphone by Unihertz is a modern BlackBerry-style device featuring a *physical QWERTY keyboard*, *5G support*, and *Android 15*.
- It offers a *slimmer design*, a *4.5-inch 1440x1440 screen*, and a *second 2-inch rear display* for notifications and selfies.
- Powered by a *Dimensity 7300 processor*, it includes *12GB RAM, 512GB storage, multiple cameras*, and advanced features like Bluetooth 5.4 and NFC.

items.title: This 55-inch QLED TV is on sale for $565 and looks like a picture frame when it isn’t being used
items.author: Brandon Russell

items.title: Apple Wallet notification for F1 movie sparks user backlash
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: - Apple sent an unexpected Apple Wallet notification promoting the *F1* movie with a ticket discount code, irritating many iPhone users. - The move is compared to Apple's past promotional missteps, like the controversial U2 album giveaway in 2014. - This aggressive ad push highlights ongoing challenges Apple faces with advertising acceptance in 2025.

items.title: Paramount Plus with Showtime rebrands to Paramount Plus Premium
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- *Paramount Plus with Showtime* tier is renamed to *Paramount Plus Premium* but still includes Showtime content without using its name.
- The price remains $12.99/month or $119.99/year; the Essential plan now also features some Showtime programming.
- The rebrand reflects smoother integration post-Showtime merger and responds to competition like Warner Bros. Discovery’s HBO Max changes.

items.title: Netflix Removes Popular Indie Games from Mobile Platform
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Netflix is delisting 22 games, including acclaimed indie titles like *Hades*, *Braid*, and *Katana Zero*, mostly on July 14, with *Hades* leaving on July 1.  
- Many of these games were exclusive to Netflix's mobile platform, risking their disappearance from Android/iOS unless released elsewhere.  
- Netflix is shifting focus toward games tied to its own shows, multiplayer, and kids' titles, aligning with popular downloads like *Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas* and *Squid Game: Unleashed*.

items.title: Hideo Kojima Sees Death Stranding 2 as a Cautionary Tale
items.author: Khee Hoon Chan
items.summary: - Hideo Kojima describes developing *Death Stranding 2* during the pandemic as his toughest challenge, adapting to remote work and rethinking the game's story amid isolation. - The sequel serves as a caution against *digital overconnectivity* and surveillance, contrasting the first game's message of connection. - Kojima aims for players to *apply the game's experience of connection* to real-life interactions post-pandemic.

items.title: Samsung offers $50 credit for preordering Galaxy foldable
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - Samsung announced an Unpacked event on July 9 to reveal its premium foldable phone lineup, including a likely Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Z Flip 7. - By reserving and preordering, customers receive a **$50 Samsung store credit** (usable on other products) and entry into a **$5,000 gift card sweepstakes**. - The new foldable may feature an **Ultra branding** and improved camera, addressing previous critiques.

items.title: Tesla’s robotaxis operating in a regulatory vacuum
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: - Tesla launched its robotaxi service in Austin, but incidents like driving on the wrong side and unsafe stops have already been recorded. - The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) is reviewing but largely powerless due to regulatory rollbacks and staffing cuts. - Federal and state agencies have limited ability to enforce safety, enabling Elon Musk’s aggressive plan to deploy up to a million robotaxis by 2026.

items.title: Google finally lets Android users put Chrome’s address bar on the bottom
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Google Chrome on Android now allows users to *move the address bar to the bottom* of the screen, improving accessibility on larger phones. - This feature, already available on iOS since 2023, offers *flexibility in browsing comfort*. - To toggle, users can press and hold the address bar or change the setting via the menu.

items.title: Microsoft offers free Windows 10 extended security updates with conditions
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: - Microsoft now allows *free* Extended Security Updates (ESU) for Windows 10 consumers until October 13, 2026, but requires enabling *Windows Backup* and syncing via *OneDrive,* which may need paid storage. - Alternatives include paying $30 annually or redeeming 1,000 Microsoft Reward points. - The move aims to encourage users to upgrade to *Windows 11* ahead of Windows 10 support ending on October 14, 2025.

items.title: Philips Hue raises US prices due to tariffs
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: - *Philips Hue* is increasing prices in the US starting July 1 *due to tariffs* imposed on Chinese imports. - Prices of products like the *Hue Play Wall Washer* and *Smart Button* have already risen compared to Europe. - The company warns future price hikes may occur if additional tariffs take effect, challenging customers to consider *more affordable alternatives*.

items.title: Fire TV Stick 4K Half Off Ahead of Prime Day
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - The *Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K* is currently available for *$24.99*, half off, ahead of Prime Day on July 8th. - It supports *4K streaming*, Dolby Vision, HDR10 Plus, Dolby Atmos, and Alexa integration. - It also offers *cloud gaming* via Xbox Game Pass and Amazon Luna with compatible controllers.

items.title: Nomad's MagSafe Wallet Integrates Tracking Card
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nomad's new Leather Mag Wallet integrates its *tracking card electronics* inside the wallet's frame, eliminating the need for a separate card slot.
- The wallet is *just 9mm thick*, holds up to four cards securely, and offers *5 months battery life* with wireless charging.
- Compatible with Apple's *Find My network* and MagSafe, but lacks ultra wideband, relying on an audible alarm for close location.

items.title: Roblox Introduces New Rewards to Boost Creator Engagement
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox launches **Creator Rewards** starting July 24th to incentivize creators for player retention and user growth.
- The **Daily Engagement Reward** pays 5 Robux per active spender spending 10+ minutes in a creator's experience, promoting regular play.
- The **Audience Expansion Reward** offers a 35% revenue share for new or returning users driven by creators, potentially increasing creator earnings beyond existing programs.

items.title: Nvidia Launches RTX 5050 GPU with Varied VRAM for Desktop and Laptop
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary: - Nvidia announced the GeForce RTX 5050 GPUs for desktops and laptops, supporting *ray tracing* and *DLSS 4*. - Desktop RTX 5050 starts at **$249**, uses 8GB *GDDR6* VRAM, while the laptop version starts at **$999** with *8GB GDDR7* VRAM. - RTX 5050 offers roughly *60% faster performance than the RTX 3050* and aims for immersive ray-traced gaming experiences.

items.title: Anthropic wins fair use ruling for training AI on purchased books
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- A federal judge ruled that *training AI models on legally purchased physical books* is *fair use*, marking a significant legal victory for Anthropic and the AI industry.
- The ruling is *limited* to physical books Anthropic bought and digitized, excluding *pirated digital books*, which require a separate trial.
- The case does *not address copyright infringement* of AI-generated outputs, leaving other legal questions unresolved.

items.title: Nintendo’s wheelchair basketball game releases in August
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - *Drag x Drive*, a 3v3 wheelchair basketball game, will launch on August 14th exclusively for the Switch 2. - It highlights the Switch 2's new *mouse controls* that simulate wheelchair maneuvering. - This adds to the Switch 2’s growing lineup of *first-party exclusives* alongside titles like *Mario Kart World* and *Donkey Kong Bananza*.

items.title: Microsoft planning ‘major’ Xbox layoffs next week
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- **Microsoft is planning significant layoffs** in its Xbox gaming division as early as next week, along with job cuts in other parts of the company.
- The layoffs are part of a broader restructuring ahead of the next generation of Xbox consoles and involve changes to Xbox distribution in central Europe.
- These cuts follow multiple rounds of layoffs over the past 18 months, including over 6,000 job cuts in May and studio closures within the Xbox and Activision Blizzard groups.

items.title: Android’s youthful new design changes call handling
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google’s Phone app gains a fresh interface aligned with *Material 3 Expressive* design to simplify calls and contacts.
- Bottom menu now has three tabs: *Home*, *Keypad*, and *Voicemail*, with the Home tab showing favorites as bubbles and individual call entries.
- A new horizontal swipe gesture to answer or decline calls aims to reduce accidental actions.

items.title: I skipped every Death Stranding cutscene and I’ll do it again
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The author completed *Death Stranding* by skipping all cutscenes, which felt too slow and clashed with the game's engaging physics-based gameplay.
- Skipping cutscenes allowed a faster focus on exploration and traversal, highlighting the game’s clever design and humor.
- The author plans to use the same approach for *Death Stranding 2*, emphasizing gameplay over storyline cinematics.

items.title: Google DeepMind’s AI model now runs directly on robots offline
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google DeepMind released an *on-device version* of its Gemini Robotics AI model that operates *without internet*, enabling robots to perform complex physical tasks offline.
- The new model, though smaller and less powerful than the flagship hybrid model, can adapt to new tasks with as few as *50-100 demonstrations* and works on multiple robot types.
- An SDK is now available for developers to evaluate and fine-tune this model, aimed at applications needing *low connectivity* or *high security* environments.

items.title: What a set of knockoff headphones taught me about headphones — and knockoffs
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: - The Picun F8 Pro headphones, a convincing AirPods Max knockoff sold via TikTok Shop, sound slightly worse but offer some preferable features at a fraction of the price. - While Apple’s AirPods Max excel in design, noise-cancellation, and usability, Picun wins on comfort, battery life, and cost-effectiveness. - This highlights a growing trend where social media-driven purchasing blurs lines between ads and reviews, making knockoffs a tempting and accessible alternative.
